claims.claim: Entry-level positions for formerly incarcerated individuals should provide a living wage.
claims.quote: we're trying to create a living wage. It's an entry level position. So in Michigan, $40,000 in insurance and stuff like that isn't bad.

claims.claim: Offering full-time positions rather than multiple part-time roles is beneficial for the quality of life of formerly incarcerated individuals.
claims.quote: we're trying to do that as opposed to, , creating three part-time positions, , for something like that because everybody who works for us is formerly incarcerated.

claims.claim: Formerly incarcerated individuals should have opportunities to build skills for further career advancement.
claims.quote: And then hopefully, They build up some of their skills, they go on to other areas and as I say, infiltrate other systems.

claims.claim: Creating job opportunities for the formerly incarcerated aids in the cycle of reintegration by making room for new participants.
claims.quote: And then we make room for the next person, , who can kind of benefit, , from that position as well.
